The Umea Region (Swedish: Umeåregionen) is a functional region which consists of six co-operating municipalities in north Sweden;
Bjurholm ,
Nordmaling ,
Robertsfors , Umeå,
Vindeln and Vännäs. The geographical area has over 140 000 inhabitants. The Umea Region does not take official decisions about benefits, allowances, invalid vehicle services and similar tasks, but generates more money to urgent purposes through scale economy depending on joint distribution of service, personal union, mutual buy-ins, etc.
History
In 1993 the six municipalities made a mutual agreement, approved by the six municipal councils, saying that:
Positive development for one municipality is a positive development for all six municipalities
Establishment of new companies and investments on one municipality should be welcomed by all without conflicts
Job opportunities should be spread throughout the Umea Region
Increased freedom of choice and better service to inhabitants
Joint development strategies
The goals and policies for the organisation were:
Better efficiency in the public sector through co-ordination and scale economy
Co-operation for development of all six municipalities
The organization must be based upon democratic principals
Today the tourism industry is the most well-developed joint project in the Umea Region, because the six municipalities together have the sea with beaches and islands, mountains with slalom slopes, forests with wild animals (elk, bear, catamount, wolf, beaver, reindeer), many lakes, rivers and rivulets for canoe-trips and fishing, ruins and heritage buildings, and the quite large city of Umeå with shopping, entertainments, restaurants with food from the cuisines of the world and night life.
Organization The council of the region meet four times a year and consists of the local government commissioners (politicians). They set up the strategic plans of the Umea Region. The head officers of the municipalities are the operative steering committee and meet once a month. There are 22 committees, in which representatives from every municipality by activity sit.
The committees are established in the following operating ranges:
Culture
Library
Business
Education
Technique
Planning
Tourism
Staff
IT
Care of the aged and the disabled
Environment
Communications
Recreations
Procurement
Gender
Waste/mud
Information
The six municipalities have mutual EU-projects: UME&Co - development of the tourism sector, City and County - local development, Library 2007 - increased access to the libraries, joint library ticket, The Grow Alliance/The train road Botniabanan as a growth factor - growth project within the region
Financing The Umea Region is financed by a fixed fee and a variable fee based on the number of inhabitants in the municipality. The annual budget is 1 500 000 SEK.
Today
The co-operation is now firmly established, and there is an exchange of knowledge and experience between politicians and public officials. The following projects have been realized:
Mutual salary system
Mutual leadership within the rescue service
Mutual organization of tourism
Mutual planning of upper secondary schools
Mutual switchboard
Mutual IT-platform
Mutual library
